page.title: 01Itteringham and surrounds
page.content: Itteringham, a village of some 40 dwellings, has a shop/post office, church, chapel and pub. Except 11 council and 5 private houses, the village and surrounds belong to one of the three estates meeting here, Mannington,Wolterton (both Walpole family) and blickling (national trust). Most villagers have some connection with farms or estates. The farm land are mainly cerel and sugar beet, with some pasturage by the River Bure. One farmer has a small herd of breeding cattle, another keeps fowls 6000 eggs a week sold for breeding puposes. The villagers have gardens and keep livestock. To the west is Mannington Hall 14th c Moated manor house, gardens open to public in summer. The old Mill is now a restaurant.Villagers recently raised
